column4: cansomeone helpe me free up 45MB of space? what files does unbuntu (or kubuntu) come with that I can safely remove?
go in synaptic and sort by the installed status and remove some stuff you dont use
it sorts the directories by size
no not h!  that will mess up sorting
you can get rid of some stuff like doc,  man,  app-install,  foomatic and cups (if you dont need to print),  example-content   etc
I just gave you a list...
you can get rid of some stuff like doc,  man,  app-install,  foomatic and cups (if you dont need to print),  example-content   etc
why would you deliberately bork someone's system?
I told him he didn't want to do that.
you said /etc/x11/xorg.config when it was actually /etc/x11/xorg.conf
the more you know, the more you realize yo udon't know
I already told you a way to free up 100+mb
you can get rid of some stuff like /usr/share   doc,  man,  app-install,  foomatic and cups (if you dont need to print),  example-content
do me a favor a nd relist that stuff you said I could remove?
